question:
Three statements are given followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.
Statements:
Some cars are grasses.
No grass is a song.
All songs are movies.
Conclusions:
I. All cars can never be songs.
II. No car is a movie.
III. All movies can never be grasses.
option_1: Only conclusion III follows
option_2: Only conclusions II and III follow
option_3: Only conclusions I and III follow

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusion(s) logically follow(s) from the statements.
Statements:
All pizza are corns.
Some corns are crows.
All crows are cars.
Conclusions:
(I) No pizzas is a car.
(II) Some cars are corns.
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: Both I and II follow
option_4: Neither conclusion I and III follow

question:

statements are true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the

given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.

Statements:

All cats are dogs.
All dogs are wolves.
No wolf is a fox.

Conclusions:
I. At least some dogs are foxes.
II. Some dogs not being cats is a possibility.
III. Some foxes are definitely not wolves.
option_1: Only II and III follow
option_2: Only I and II follow
option_4: All I, II and III follow
